title: How many days does it take for black magic to wear off? - Quora

response.answer_text: In most cases, magic, whether good or ill intentioned, doesn’t “wear off”. Whether or not it expires is based on a number of factors, including the specific spell used, the intention of the caster, the strength of the magic, whether and how quickly it does what it’s supposed to do, etc. Let’s say someone cast a spell to break up your current relationship. In that case, the day you two broke up would mark the end of the spell. The magic wouldn’t continue to follow you since the work would’ve been done. However, if someone cast a spell to break up all your relationships, and leave you forever alone, it would continue to come after you time and again, because the work was unfinished. The results of the magic are also affected by the strength of the caster’s feelings. Let’s say your ex cast this spell. If he or she is angry but ambivalent, or new to magic, the spell would probably die before it got far enough to accomplish anything. However, if your ex was full of carefully honed and focused hatred, and had the experience to create a powerful curse, it could yield lifelong results. Instead of waiting for black magic to give up, I suggest meeting it directly. There are many people who can break spells. There are also protective spells and other resources, like amulets, that can mediate and offer protection from the dark magic. The best remedy, of course, is to make peace with the one who cursed you. Change their heart and they’ll no longer have the concentration or emotion to sustain the magic they’ve put into place.

Once again, MAGICK HAS NO COLOR. It’s a tool. Use it for ill or good, but it is COLORLESS. Turn off the computer games and come out of the basement. Crack open a book and LEARN about it. As for “…how long it takes to wear off…” NOTHING IS PERMANENT. EVER. Not the ground under your feet. (The tectonic plates are in constant motion) Not the Earth you’re on. (It’s spinning) Not the planet you’re inhabiting. (It’s in orbit) Not the solar system you’re in. (It’s expanding) Anyone who tells you otherwise is a delusional grifter. The magick ends when the effect is obtained. “I want him to love me!” He stops by for a chat and you can then see if you two are a good fit. BANG! Spell is done. It really is that simple. And, NO there are no compound rituals. “I want you to lose your job and always be alone ” Nope. Not only would the universe stop something like that, for your own good, but even if such a thing existed then you’d burn out like a match. Why? Because there is a power exchange. Magick isn’t free. That’s why actual practitioners are very careful when and how they use it and why many have physical ailments in some form. Movement of any kind, including change requires energy. THERE IS A COST. (BTW, there’s also no such thing as a “caster.” Mage, witch, or priest/ess since we are talking about either 1. a religion or 2. an area of study.) Magick requires actual logic and thought. Otherwise it’s “wishcraft” at best. One who uses magick is NOT a god. Beware the Unwashed masses who will give you that suggestion, or the terrified who will believe it.
